title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1426/87 of 25 May 1987 fixing for the 1987/88 marketing year the reference prices for lemons
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1426/87
of 25 May 1987
fixing for the 1987/88 marketing year the reference prices for lemons
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
For the 1987/88 marketing year, the reference prices for fresh lemons falling within subheading 08.02 C of the Common Customs Tariff, expressed in ECU per 100 kilograms net of packed products of class I, of all sizes, shall be as follows:
- June: 54,59
- July and August: 59,98
- September: 55,24
- October: 49,61
- November to April: 46,95
- May: 47,53.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 June 1987.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 25 May 1987.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
